feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Business One
feed.subtitle: SAP Business One Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Why Does SAP B1 Allow Backdated Delivery Without Inventory? (Moving Average + Negative Stock Issue)
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

My colleague encountered a confusing behavior in SAP Business One 10.0 FP 2402 HF01 (SQL version) related to backdated deliveries and inventory logic. We'd like to ask for your insights.

Localization：China

Scenario:

  • In a test database, we used a brand-new item that had zero inventory.

  • On 2025/08/15, we posted a Goods Receipt of 1,000 units, unit cost = 1.00 (Posting Date = 2025/08/15).

  • Then we created two Delivery documents with Posting Dates set as:

    • 2025/08/01 (Delivered 1 unit)

    • 2025/08/10 (Delivered 1 unit)

To our surprise, both deliveries were posted successfully, even though the item had no inventory on those posting dates (08/01 & 08/10).

Accounting Observations:

  • The Inventory Audit Report, when filtered between 2025/08/01 ~ 2025/08/10, shows the item’s stock as -2.

  • The G/L report, for the same date range, shows a negative balance for the inventory account.

System Configuration:

Company-Level Settings:

  • ✅ Perpetual Inventory: Enabled

  • ✅ Item Valuation Method: Moving Average

  • ✅ “Allow stock release without item cost”: Checked

Document Settings (Administration → System Initialization → Document Settings):

  • ✅ Block Negative Inventory By: Warehouse

 

Questions:

  1. Why does the system allow delivery posting with backdated posting dates, even when no inventory existed on those dates?

  2. In this case, how is the Moving Average cost calculated and adjusted after the receipt is posted later?

  3. Are there any best practices or system controls to prevent this kind of unexpected delivery posting?

I’ve attached screenshots of the Inventory Audit Report and system configuration for reference.
Looking forward to your advice and insights—thanks in advance!

entry.title: SAP B1 C# - Is there a way to simulate clicking on a magnifying glass icon in TextBox?
entry.content:
My TextBox in a form is linked to a User-Defined Values (Saved Query) so there is a magnifying glass icon inside the box.

Is there a way to use C# SAPBOUICOM (SAP B1 UI API) to simulate clicking on that icon to open a query data?

I need a form of draft document to query a data once a form is opened (Already set as Refresh Regularly). It works on a non-draft document but not looks up for a query data when opened a draft document. So I guess UI API might help.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Error: Import Fixed Asset Master Data from Microsoft Excel
entry.content:
Hello,

I' receiving the following error.

La fecha de inicio de la amortización del activo fijo "AF-000003" para el área de amortización "DEP_CONTABLE" no puede estar en el ejercicio importado

(The depreciation start date for fixed asset "AF-000003" for depreciation area "DEP_CONTABLE" cannot be in the imported fiscal year.)

I chose the previous fiscal year to import and set the dates at the first day of the year.

 

 Descripción del artículoClase AFFecha capitalizaciónÁrea de valoraciónFecha apertura valoraciónVida útilResto vida útilClase amortizaciónCAPAmortización acumulada ordinaria
AF-000003HP ProBook 450 G9 Notebook PCCAF-COMPUTO20240101DEP_CONTABLE202401014836CA-COMPUTO160004000

I picked the previous year becaues the same error comes out with the current year as well.  Could anyone help me understand this error?

Thank you for your support in advance.

Regards,

Koichi

entry.title: Set Batches for child items of a Sales BOM Item in SAP B1 SDK
entry.content:
Dear all

I am facing a challenge where I have to make an A/R Invoice document (through SAP B1 DI API) with some items that have a Sales BoM (Non Inventory Item) and some of the child items of these parent/BoM items are batch managed.

In case of NON-BATCH items, I would just have one line in the document and set parent item code and post the A/R Invoice and it automatically fetches and sets the child items without any issue. But in case of a Batch Managed child items, I get the "Cannot Add Row Without Complete Selection of Batches" error because it expects the batches to be set for the child items.

Now, what I do not understand is that how do I link the the batches of these child items with their item codes/lines. Because, the child lines/items are not fetched/set before the document is posted, it only happens AFTER you post it.

I tried setting the batches for the parent line but that does not work.

I tried manually fetching the child items (with query from ITT1) and adding new rows and set their batches, but even that doesn't work because the actual child items of the parent item are still not getting their batches set.

Also, fetching and setting child items manually just adds additional lines on top of the parent/child combination (verified by posting the draft invoice document). 

So far, the only solution I can think of is that since I can successfully post an A/R Invoice draft (which also fetches and sets the child items of the Sales BoM Item), I should just post draft, fetch it again, and then set the batches. However, that is a longer route and has a higher cost, so, I would want to avoid that. 

Has anyone encountered the above issue and successfully resolved it?

Thanks in advance
Regards

entry.title: System default Main budget clarification in SAP B1 [1st time upload Budget SAPVer10 Fp2111]
entry.content:
Hi SAP B1 Team,

Can I use the system locked and default "Main budget [Grey Condition]" budget scenario and upload the budgets as per below screen shots.  Is it cause any issue in the reporting and future transaction issues?

Note:

1.  This is our new SAP B1 system ver 10 FP2111 and start to setup budget scenario,  When we start budget scenario system automatically created 1st row as "Main Budget [Grey Condition] with locked condition [I checekd backend and shown as locked in the main budget].  In this case can I use this Main budget scenario to upload the budgets like the below screenshots? Pls check and let me know your valuable feedback for this.   
2.  For your info., System allows to upload the budget details without any issue by DTW process [Grey and Locked Main budget (System default)

Thanks & Regards,

Mohan Sivakumar

entry.title: Request for SAP Business One Access for Learning Purpose
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

I hope you are doing well.

I am currently learning SAP Business One and I am very passionate about understanding its features and functionality in a practical environment. I would like to request access to a demo or trial version of SAP Business One for educational purposes only.

If there is any way to get limited or sandbox access, even for a short time, I would be extremely grateful. I am not affiliated with any company and this is purely for self-learning and skill development.

Please let me know if there are any options or platforms where I can access SAP Business One legally for training purposes.

Thank you very much for your support and guidance.

Best regards,
Haider Imam

entry.title: No matching records found 'G/L Accounts' (OACT) (ODBC -2028) [Message 131-183]
entry.content:
Dear 

In Sap B1 HANA on General tab of Inventory master, There is field "Material Type" having value "Raw Material", "Capital Good", "Finish Good".

When i going add A/P Invoice with item having type "Capital Good", it give error "No matching records found 'G/L Accounts' (OACT) (ODBC -2028) [Message 131-183]".

when i changed it to finish good, then it get added successfully.

please tell there is any relation between this Material Type and Gl determination ?

What is the G/L determination for Capital Good (Without using Fix Asset Management) ?

Regards

Narendra Dashpute

entry.content:

Any way to configured Gmail account for SBO mailer. Please advice.

entry.title: user-defined fields blocked/read only SAP BO Purchase Order Window
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a user who has the Financial Limited license, who has access to the Purchase Order window. He is able to query any PO with the PO number, using the Find (binocular) button. The problem is that he is the only user who cannot use this Find button to query with User-Defined fields values. These fields appears blocked, like read-only fields. I "Restore Default" the window, putting back all user-defined fields to the original position, and put them back. Same thing. Attached the Purchase Order Windows for you to see the problem. I have searched for a solution with no solution available, I have no idea how to solve it, I appreciate your help and your time.

Thanks!

entry.title: UDT creation fails in SBODemoAU database
entry.content:
Hi,

We have a program which creates a number of UDTs and UDFs inside a demo DB (SBODemoUS). This uses inTransaction before the start of the process so that if any error happens in between the whole process can be rolled back.This works fine with SBODemoUS DB. But this process fails in SBODemoAU, SBODemoDE databases when we tested. There is no error getting logged. The SAP B1 UI getting non responsive. And this is not happening at a particular point in execution of code.it is random at different fields creation. How can we troubleshoot this? Is there any settings to be checked with these two databases?

Thanks,

Deepesh

When get the error user need to refresh the web browser to continue the work, can someone help to resolve the issue ?

entry.title: FMS In Good Issue
entry.content:
HI experts ,

I am implementing FMS in Good Issue to change  Account code based on Department cost center selected by user.This is my current Query,it works.but what happens is when i select the department,the account code gets updated,but the department is left blank.I have to again select the department.how can I achieve sth like whenever i change department code,the account code should be changed and department should be reflected rather than me having to select department again.I have attached my FMS set up as well.

SELECT
CASE
WHEN IFNULL($[$13.10001010.0], '') = 'IDC-1027' THEN '5001014'
WHEN IFNULL($[$13.10001010.0], '') = 'IDC-1028' THEN '5001015'
ELSE '100017' -- default account if blank or any other value
END
FROM DUMMY
